intro: Obione sibirica, commonly known as Siberian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the cold climates of Siberia and other northern regions. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine environments. Obione sibirica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
